cohorts.label: CH Motor - Accessory Damage - Last 180 Days
cohorts.description: Swiss Motor/Casco claims with accessory line items, loss date within last 180 days

cohorts.label: CH Motor - Unknown Accessory Status
cohorts.description: Swiss Motor/Casco claims where accessory declaration status is unknown

cohorts.label: CH Motor - All Claims - Last 180 Days
cohorts.description: All Swiss Motor/Casco claims with loss date within last 180 days

proposed_changes.label: Accessory Coverage: Include By Default
proposed_changes.description: Change ACCESSORY_COVERAGE interpretation default from INCLUDED_IF_DECLARED to INCLUDED_BY_DEFAULT, covering all aftermarket accessories regardless of declaration status

proposed_changes.label: Assumption: Favor Customer (Assume Declared)
proposed_changes.description: Change recommended assumption resolution for unknown accessory status from NOT_DECLARED to DECLARED, adopting a customer-favorable approach

proposed_changes.label: Accessory Coverage: Exclude All
proposed_changes.description: Change ACCESSORY_COVERAGE interpretation to EXCLUDED, removing all aftermarket accessory coverage from base policies

study_results.cohort_label: CH Motor - Accessory Damage - Last 180 Days
study_results.summary: Changing to INCLUDED_BY_DEFAULT would increase payouts by CHF 1,200. One claim (CLM-CH-001) with unknown accessory status would automatically receive accessory coverage for tow bar replacement, eliminating the need for assumption resolution.

Changing recommended assumption to DECLARED would increase payouts by CHF 1,200 for claims with unknown accessory status. WARNING: This creates an inconsistency - the assumption favors coverage while the interpretation (INCLUDED_IF_DECLARED) still gates on declaration. Consider aligning both policies.
study_results.inconsistency_detail: The proposed assumption change recommends treating accessories as declared, but the current interpretation (INCLUDED_IF_DECLARED) creates a logical dependency. If the goal is customer-favorable treatment, consider also changing the interpretation to INCLUDED_BY_DEFAULT for consistency.

study_results.cohort_label: CH Motor - Accessory Damage - Last 180 Days
study_results.summary: Changing to EXCLUDED would reduce payouts by CHF 2,750 across 4 claims. All claims with declared accessories would lose accessory coverage. This represents a significant policy change affecting customer expectations.

study_results.cohort_label: CH Motor - Accessory Damage - Last 180 Days
study_results.summary: Within accessory claims, only CLM-CH-001 has unknown declaration status. Changing the assumption to favor 'declared' would cover the CHF 1,200 tow bar. Other claims in this cohort already have known accessory status and are unaffected by assumption changes.

Changing interpretation to INCLUDED_BY_DEFAULT would automatically cover the CHF 1,200 tow bar for CLM-CH-001, bypassing the need for assumption resolution entirely. This is the cleanest solution for unknown accessory status claims.

No impact on unknown status claims. Under current policy (INCLUDED_IF_DECLARED), accessories with unknown declaration status are already not covered by default. Changing to EXCLUDED has no additional effect on these claims.

study_results.cohort_label: CH Motor - All Claims - Last 180 Days
study_results.summary: Across all 10 claims, only those with undeclared or unknown accessories would gain coverage. CLM-CH-001 (unknown status, CHF 1,200 tow bar) would be covered. Most claims either have no accessories or already have declared accessories covered under current policy.

study_results.cohort_label: CH Motor - All Claims - Last 180 Days
study_results.summary: Across all 10 claims, only CLM-CH-001 has unknown accessory declaration status requiring an assumption. The customer-favorable assumption would add CHF 1,200 in coverage. Note: This creates a policy inconsistency - consider pairing with interpretation change.
study_results.inconsistency_detail: Changing only the assumption creates an implicit dependency on interpretation logic. For a consistent customer-favorable approach across the portfolio, consider also changing the interpretation to INCLUDED_BY_DEFAULT.

study_results.cohort_label: CH Motor - All Claims - Last 180 Days
study_results.summary: Excluding all accessories across the entire portfolio would reduce payouts by CHF 2,750. Four claims with declared accessories would lose coverage. This is the same impact as the accessory-specific cohort since only declared accessories are currently covered.
